intro: Cerberiopsis candelabra var. vexillaria, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a unique species of flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often in a striking red or orange color. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unusual blooms. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with a compact and bushy habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
